Basic linear algebra¶

Level 1¶

Adjoint¶

Note

This is not a standard BLAS routine, but it is BLAS-like.

.

void basic::Adjoint(const Matrix<T>& A, Matrix<T>& B)¶

The serial version (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Adjoint(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& A, DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& B)¶

The distributed version (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Axpy¶

Performs (hence the name axpy).

void basic::Axpy(T alpha, const Matrix<T>& X, Matrix<T>& Y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Axpy(T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& X, DistMatrix<T, U, V>& Y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the shared distribution of and ).

Conjugate¶

Note

This is not a standard BLAS routine, but it is BLAS-like.

. For real datatypes, this is a no-op.

void basic::Conjugate(Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial version (templated over datatype).

void basic::Conjugate(DistMatrix<T, U, V>& A)¶

The distributed version (templated over the datatype and the distribution of ).

.

void basic::Conjugate(const Matrix<T>& A, Matrix<T>& B)¶

The serial version (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Conjugate(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& A, DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& B)¶

The distributed version (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Copy¶

Sets .

void basic::Copy(const Matrix<T>& X, Matrix<T>& Y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Copy(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& A, DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& B)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

DiagonalScale¶

Note

This is not a standard BLAS routine, but it is BLAS-like.

Performs either or , where equals , or , where and is a column vector.

void basic::DiagonalScale(Side side, Orientation orientation, const Matrix<T>& d, Matrix<T>& X)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::DiagonalScale(Side side, Orientation orientation, const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& d, DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& X)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

DiagonalSolve¶

Note

This is not a standard BLAS routine, but it is BLAS-like.

Performs either or , where and is a column vector.

void basic::DiagonalSolve(Side side, Orientation orientation, const Matrix<F>& d, Matrix<F>& X, bool checkIfSingular=false )¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::DiagonalSolve(Side side, Orientation orientation, const DistMatrix<F, U, V>& d, DistMatrix<F, W, Z>& X, bool checkIfSingular=false )¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Dot¶

Returns . and are both allowed to be stored as column or row vectors, but will be interpreted as column vectors.

T basic::Dot(const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

T basic::Dot(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& x, const DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Dotc¶

Same as basic::Dot. This routine name is provided since it is the usual BLAS naming convention.

T basic::Dotc(const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

T basic::Dotc(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& x, const DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Dotu¶

Returns , which is not an inner product.

T basic::Dotu(const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

T basic::Dotu(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& x, const DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Nrm2¶

Returns . As with most other routines, even if is stored as a row vector, it will be interpreted as a column vector.

R basic::Nrm2(const Matrix<R>& x)¶

Serial version for real datatypes.

R basic::Nrm2(const Matrix<std::complex<R>>& x)¶

Serial version for complex datatypes.

R basic::Nrm2(const DistMatrix<R, MC, MR>& x)¶

Distributed version for real datatypes.

R basic::Nrm2(const DistMatrix<std::complex<R>, MC, MR>& x)¶

Distributed version for complex datatypes.

Scal¶

.

void basic::Scal(T alpha, Matrix<T>& X)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Scal(T alpha, DistMatrix<T, U, V>& X)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype and the distribution of ).

Transpose¶

Note

This is not a standard BLAS routine, but it is BLAS-like.

.

void basic::Transpose(const Matrix<T>& A, Matrix<T>& B)¶

The serial version (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Transpose(const DistMatrix<T, U, V>& A, DistMatrix<T, W, Z>& B)¶

The distributed version (templated over the datatype and the individual distributions of and ).

Level 2¶

Gemv¶

General matrix-vector multiply: , where can be , , or . Whether or not and are stored as row vectors, they will be interpreted as column vectors.

void basic::Gemv(Orientation orientation, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& x, T beta, Matrix<T>& y)¶

Serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Gemv(Orientation orientation, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y)¶

Distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Ger¶

General rank-one update: . and are free to be stored as either row or column vectors, but they will be interpreted as column vectors.

void basic::Ger(T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Ger(T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Gerc¶

This is the same as basic::Ger, but the name is provided because it exists in the BLAS.

void basic::Gerc(T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Gerc(T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Geru¶

General rank-one update (unconjugated): . and are free to be stored as either row or column vectors, but they will be interpreted as column vectors.

void basic::Geru(T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Geru(T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Hemv¶

Hermitian matrix-vector multiply: , where is Hermitian.

void basic::Hemv(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& x, T beta, Matrix<T>& y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Hemv(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Her¶

Hermitian rank-one update: implicitly performs , where only the triangle of specified by shape is updated.

void basic::Her(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Her(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Her2¶

Hermitian rank-two update: implicitly performs , where only the triangle of specified by shape is updated.

void basic::Her2(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Her2(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Symv¶

Symmetric matrix-vector multiply: , where is symmetric.

void basic::Symv(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& x, T beta, Matrix<T>& y)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Symv(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Syr¶

Symmetric rank-one update: implicitly performs , where only the triangle of specified by shape is updated.

void basic::Syr(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Syr(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Syr2¶

Symmetric rank-two update: implicitly performs , where only the triangle of specified by shape is updated.

void basic::Syr2(Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& x, const Matrix<T>& y, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Syr2(Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& x, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& y, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Trmv¶

Not yet written. Please call Trmm.

Trsv¶

Triangular solve with a vector: computes , where is either , , or , and is treated an either a lower or upper triangular matrix, depending upon shape. can also be treated as implicitly having a unit diagonal if diagonal is set to UNIT.

void basic::Trsv(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, const Matrix<F>& A, Matrix<F>& x)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Trsv(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, const DistMatrix<F, MC, MR>& A, DistMatrix<F, MC, MR>& x)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Level 3¶

Gemm¶

General matrix-matrix multiplication: updates , where and can each be chosen from , , and .

void basic::Gemm(Orientation orientationOfA, Orientation orientationOfB, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& B, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Gemm(Orientation orientationOfA, Orientation orientationOfB, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Hemm¶

Hermitian matrix-matrix multiplication: updates , or , depending upon whether side is set to LEFT or RIGHT, respectively. In both of these types of updates, is implicitly Hermitian and only the triangle specified by shape is accessed.

void basic::Hemm(Side side, Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& B, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Hemm(Side side, Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Her2k¶

Hermitian rank-2K update: updates , or , depending upon whether orientation is set to NORMAL or ADJOINT, respectively. Only the triangle of specified by the shape parameter is modified.

void basic::Her2k(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& B, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Her2k(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Herk¶

Hermitian rank-K update: updates , or , depending upon whether orientation is set to NORMAL or ADJOINT, respectively. Only the triangle of specified by the shape parameter is modified.

void basic::Herk(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Herk(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Hetrmm¶

Note

This routine directly corresponds with the LAPACK routines ?lauum, but it only involves matrix-matrix multiplication, so it is lumped in with the BLAS-like routines in Elemental.

Hermitian triangular matrix-matrix multiply: performs or , depending upon the choice of the shape parameter.

void basic::Hetrmm(Shape shape, Matrix<T>& A)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Hetrmm(Shape shape, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Symm¶

Symmetric matrix-matrix multiplication: updates , or , depending upon whether side is set to LEFT or RIGHT, respectively. In both of these types of updates, is implicitly symmetric and only the triangle specified by shape is accessed.

void basic::Symm(Side side, Shape shape, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& B, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Symm(Side side, Shape shape, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Syr2k¶

Symmetric rank-2K update: updates , or , depending upon whether orientation is set to NORMAL or TRANSPOSE, respectively. Only the triangle of specified by the shape parameter is modified.

void basic::Syr2k(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, const Matrix<T>& B, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Syr2k(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Syrk¶

Symmetric rank-K update: updates , or , depending upon whether orientation is set to NORMAL or TRANSPOSE, respectively. Only the triangle of specified by the shape parameter is modified.

void basic::Syrk(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, T beta, Matrix<T>& C)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Syrk(Shape shape, Orientation orientation, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, T beta, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& C)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Trmm¶

Triangular matrix-matrix multiplication: performs , or , depending upon whether side was chosen to be LEFT or RIGHT, respectively. Whether is treated as lower or upper triangular is determined by shape, and can be any of , , and (and diagonal determines whether is treated as unit diagonal or not).

void basic::Trmm(Side side, Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, Matrix<T>& B)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Trmm(Side side, Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Trsm¶

Triangular solve with multiple right-hand sides: performs , or , depending upon whether side was chosen to be LEFT or RIGHT, respectively. Whether is treated as lower or upper triangular is determined by shape, and can be any of , , and (and diagonal determines whether is treated as unit diagonal or not).

void basic::Trsm(Side side, Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, T alpha, const Matrix<T>& A, Matrix<T>& B)¶

The serial implementation (templated over the datatype).

void basic::Trsm(Side side, Shape shape, Orientation orientation, Diagonal diagonal, T alpha, const DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& A, DistMatrix<T, MC, MR>& B)¶

The distributed implementation (templated over the datatype).

Tuning parameters¶

The following tuning parameters have been exposed since they are system-dependent and can have a large impact on performance. The first two sets of tuning parameters, those of LocalHemvBlocksize and LocalSymvBlocksize, should probably be combined.

LocalHemvBlocksize¶

void basic::SetLocalHemvBlocksize<T>(int blocksize)¶

Sets the local blocksize for the distributed basic::Hemv routine for datatype T. It is set to 64 by default and is important for the Householder reduction of a Hermitian matrix to symmetric tridiagonal form.

int basic::LocalHemvBlocksize<T>()¶

Retrieves the local Hemv blocksize for datatype T.

LocalSymvBlocksize¶

void basic::SetLocalSymvBlocksize<T>(int blocksize)¶

Sets the local blocksize for the distributed basic::Symv routine for datatype T. It is set to 64 by default.

int basic::LocalSymvBlocksize<T>()¶

Retrieves the local Symv blocksize for datatype T.

LocalTriangularRankKBlocksize¶

void basic::SetLocalTriangularRankKBlocksize<T>(int blocksize)¶

Sets the local blocksize for the distributed basic::internal::LocalTriangularRankK routine for datatype T. It is set to 64 by default and is important for routines that perform distributed basic::Syrk or basic::Herk updates, e.g., Cholesky factorization.

int basic::LocalTriangularRankKBlocksize<T>()¶

Retrieves the local blocksize for the distributed basic::internal::LocalTriangularRankK routine for datatype T.

LocalTriangularRank2KBlocksize¶

void basic::SetLocalTriangularRank2KBlocksize<T>(int blocksize)¶

Sets the local blocksize for the distributed basic::internal::LocalTriangularRank2K routine for datatype T. It is set to 64 by default and is important for routines that perform distributed basic::Syr2k or basic::Her2k updates, e.g., Householder tridiagonalization.

int basic::LocalTriangularRank2KBlocksize<T>()¶

Retrieves the local blocksize for the distributed basic::internal::LocalTriangularRank2K routine for datatype T.
